resources:
Stay Safe Comment //rape
"Section 363 of the Penal Code defines Rape as follows:

"
"1. Sexual intercourse without consent
" "2. Sexual intercourse with consent where the woman is in lawful/unlawful detention or where consent has been obtained through intimidation or force.
" "3. Where consent has been obtained when the woman was administered alcohol/drugs by the perpetrator or someone else.

"
"• Penetration is sufficient to constitute rape.
" "• Ejaculation is not necessary.
" "• Evidence of resistance such as physical injury is not essential to prove rape.
" "• A girl under the age of 16 years of age has NO CAPACITY to consent to sexual intercourse, and therefore a person engaging in sexual intercourse with a girl under the age of 16 is punishable for the offence of Statutory Rape.

" ""
"If you are a victim of rape, or you know someone who has been subjected to rape:

"
"• Confide in someone you can trust or talk to WIN
" "• Do not change clothes or clean your body before a medical examination
" "• Lodge a complaint at the nearest police station
" "• Ask copy of the complaint and reference number
" "• Obtain a medical report from a hospital within 24 hours
" "• Record all details of the incident for your future reference
" "• Receive counseling and/or legal advice from WIN
"
